actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Wilson (SC) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, January 9, 2026, it adjourn to meet on Monday, January 12, 2026, at noon for Morning-Hour debate and at 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 263

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 5184.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4593, H.R. 5184 and H.R. 6938. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4593, H.R. 5184, and H.R. 6938 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and provides for one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 977. H.R. 5184 â€” "To prohibit the Secretary of Energy from enforcing energy efficiency standards applicable to manufactured housing, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Schneider to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Major General William Green, Jr., Chief of Chaplains, U.S. Army, Washington, DC
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
